prompt: Facts: Petition filed by Sonu (Petitioner) under Section 482 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 (CrPC) seeking quashing of FIR No. 0036/2022.; The FIR was registered on 12.01.2022 at Police Station Dwarka Sector-23, New Delhi.; The FIR was registered at the instance of Respondent No. 2 (wife of the Petitioner) for offences under Sections 498A, 406, and 34 of the Indian Penal Code (IPC).; The FIR stemmed from matrimonial disputes between the Petitioner and Respondent No. 2.; During the pendency of proceedings, the parties resolved their disputes amicably.; A settlement agreement was reached between the parties before the Mediation Centre, Saket Courts, New Delhi, recorded in a report dated 06.12.2023.; As per the settlement, a total sum of Rs. 4,00,000 was agreed to be paid by the Petitioner to Respondent No. 2 as full and final settlement.; The first installment of Rs. 2,00,000 was paid by the Petitioner to Respondent No. 2.; The parties obtained a decree of divorce by mutual consent under Section 13B(2) of the Hindu Marriage Act, 1955, from the Family Court, Saket Courts, New Delhi, on 10.01.2024.; Both Petitioner and Respondent No. 2 appeared before the High Court (identified by the Investigating Officer) and affirmed the settlement.; Respondent No. 2 stated before the High Court that she entered into the settlement voluntarily, without any fear, force, or coercion, and had no objection to the quashing of the FIR.; The Learned Additional Public Prosecutor (APP) for the State (Respondent No. 1) also stated no objection to the quashing of the FIR based on the settlement. | IPC: Section 34 (Acts done by several persons in furtherance of common intention), Section 406 (Punishment for criminal breach of trust), Section 498A (Husband or relative of husband of a woman subjecting her to cruelty)
